intro: Dirichletia venulosa, commonly known as the slender dirichletia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. Its small, tubular flowers are typically white or pale pink, and they bloom in clusters. Dirichletia venulosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
